oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eating quality of filet and round from grazing Holstein bulls and Limousine x Holstein Bulls and Heifers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Therkildsen, M.
Vestergaard, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Production systems
Food security, food quality and human health
Beef cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Crossbred Limousine x Holstein bulls and heifers may be an alternative to purebred Holstein bulls in organic beef production of young cattle because of the improved gain, carcass conformation and taste, but the fatness and texture of the crossbred bulls need to be improved through changes in the production strategy, especially feeding prior to slaughter, and in the pre and post mortem handling.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Therkildsen, M. and Vestergaard, M. (2014) Eating quality of filet and round from grazing Holstein bulls and Limousine x Holstein Bulls and Heifers. In: Therkildsen, M. and Vestergaard, M. (Eds.) Aarhus Universitet, p. 1.
